Articles.Content:
When I try to download 0.25, I get this error:

Warning: session_start(): The session id is too long or contains illegal characters, valid characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and '-,' in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: session_start(): Cannot send session cookie - headers already sent by (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: session_start(): Cannot send session cache limiter - headers already sent (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php on line 9

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/config.php:9) in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/multiplayDwn.php on line 11

Invalid Token

How can this be fixed? I want 0.25 so much!
Not that it's much help, but I'm having the same issue... also chomping at the bit for 0.25
You'll have to wait until fewer people are downloading the game Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the servers are overloaded just like the last update. We're all in the same boat.
You'd think someone would learn something when it happens every update.
It has started working for me now (after much refreshing).
I can confirm this issue. Why do error messages never give you any useful information?

It does give useful information. It says exactly what went wrong, and where. Trouble is, that doesn't always translate directly to a real-world occurrence, timing issue, server load, etc. But yes, it would seem the servers are overloaded -- similar errors were abundant during the days after the 0.24 release.
Now when I try to download, the file gets corrupted during the download. It's happened to me twice now.

It might be best to try using a download manager. If you have Firefox, you can get the DownThemAll! extension, which will handle it very well. When the servers are busy, it's unfortunately a little too common for downloads to be dropped mid-way through the file transfer.
